clinical_study.brief_title: AMH, Glucose Intolerance and Metabolic Syndrome in PCOS

brief_summary.textblock: Association between serum anti-Mullerian hormone (AMH) level and prevalence of glucose intolerance and metabolic syndrome in women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS)

detailed_description.textblock:
- To study the association between serum anti-Mullerian hormone (AMH) level and glucose intolerance and metabolic syndrome in women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).
- Glucose intolerance is detected by 2-hours 75 gram oral glucose tolerance test (OGTT).
- Metabolic syndrome is diagnosed by using the Harmonized criteria; the presence of any 3 of 5 following risk factors constitutes a diagnosis of metabolic syndrome.
1. Elevated waist circumference (> 80 cm in Asian women)
2. Elevated triglycerides (> 150 mg/dL)
3. Reduced HDL-cholesterol (< 50 mg/dL)
4. Elevated blood pressure )systolic > 130 and/or diastolic > 85 mmHg)
5. Elevated fasting glucose ( > 100 mg/dL)
- Percentage of glucose intolerance and metabolic syndrome in PCOS women as well was any differences in parameters between PCOS patients with and without glucose intolerance and metabolic syndrome will be analysed.

primary_outcome.measure: Differences between serum AMH level between PCOS women with and without glucose intolerance and metabolic syndrome
primary_outcome.description: Any differences between mean of serum AMH levels in PCOS with and without glucose intolerance and metabolic syndrome

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of glucose intolerance in PCOS women
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of glucose intolerance detected by 75 g OGTT in PCOS women

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of metabolic syndrome in PCOS women
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of metabolic syndrome defined by the Harmonized criteria in PCOS women

arm_group.description: PCOS women diagnosed by Rotterdam criteria visiting the Gynecologic Unit at King Chulalongkorn Memorial Hospital and meet the inclusion criteria and no exclusion criteria of the study

intervention.description: Serum for serum anti-Mullerian hormone, 2-hour 75 gram oral glucose tolerance test and lipid profiles

biospec_descr.textblock:
- Serum anti-mullerian hormone level
- Blood test for 2-hours 75 gram glucose tolerance test
- Blood tests for total cholesterol, HDL-cholesterol, LDL-cholesterol and triglycerides

study_pop.textblock: Thai women with PCOS diagnosed by Rotterdam criteria 2003 who visit at Gynecological Department, King Chulalongkorn Memorial Hospital, Bangkok,Thailand

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- PCOS diagnosed by Rotterdam criteria 2003
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Previous any hormonal uses in the last 3 months
- Previous hypoglycemic drugs or insulin-sensitising agents use in the last 3 months
- Previous chemotherapy, ovarian surgery, pelvic irradiation
- Menopause
